page.title: 02Employment in Chilton area.
page.content: Many people are unemployed in Chilton. Most of those who have jobs travel to nearby towns to work, although a newly developed small industrial estate in Chilton itself is providing more local employment. Thirty or forty years ago nearly all the men in Chilton would have been employed in the local coal mines but these have since shut down and there is now little evidence of their existence. In a survey that we conducted in our school we found that Newton Aycliffe, a new town five miles south of Chilton, had most parents, both mothers and fathers, working there in a variety of jobs in the industrial estates. Electrical engineering, lawn- mower manufacture and photocopying equipment are included in these occupations.
